Reviews.Title: “Nothing can beat this price”
Reviews.Author: MaryLandry
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in March 2012 on a romantic trip with my boyfriend. The room was very clean, the staff friendly, and the rooms are all newly renovated. Although it is far from luxury, the cheap price made my week ! Positive : Great location near the metro and quartier latin, friendly staff (they let us use their microwave even if there wasn't one in our room), control over the AC and heating in our room, new bathroom and new decoration in the room, all very clean. Also, if you want a quiet area, room 303 is in the back and you don't hear a single neighbor. We were very surprised to see a "no vacancy" sign on the second night, we hadn't hear a single guest ! Negative : Those are really just details, like no elevators, no breakfast, the rooms being pretty small.... But really, if you want breakfast, you have a nice fridge and kettle in your room, and the stairs are far from bad. For the price they ask, this place is pretty unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Clean, OK for <2 nights”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 102 (ground floor) for 2 nights in Feb 2012. We had a bathroom next door for our own, but not ensuite. Positive: - Location (Quartier Latin, 2 min to Metro station) - Clean (both room and bathroom) - Towels provided - Bed OK - Room service - Flat Screen TV - Nice staff - Price! Negative: - Not soundproof! You will hear everything going on outside, plus the air conditioning is pretty loud too. Definitely bring earplugs. I could not sleep even although I did. - They use absolutely unbearable air freshener. I'm not a sissy, but I could hardly breathe. - Room pretty small, no wardrobe, rather cold - On the day of our departure, there was no hot water in the bathroom. ALL IN ALL: It's OK if you stay for a weekend and spend most of your time outside. It's clean and has rather reasonable prices and nice staff. For >2 nights, the room size and wafer thin walls might make your stay a rather uncomfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great littel hotel; good location and value!”
Reviews.Author: KenandDi
Reviews.Content: Our group of 8 stayed at the Visitel in the summer of 2011 for several days. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, going out of their way to ensure our comfort. The location was great, central for "old town". All in all, excellent value ! Ken/Diana

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Shortymaria
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 4 and got a room,301,that had 2 separate rooms,but no door separating the rooms though which wasn't a problem for us at all. We even had our own balcony.we managed to get a free parking spot that could just fit our dodge caravan. The staff was ok, the room was good considering it was so cheap. The walls are thin and could hear a couple practicing bedroom gymnastics in the middle of the night. Great location by main bus station and metro and also convenient for walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewNVT
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place to stay for an overnight that was clean but not overpriced: Hotel Visitel fit the bill. Great location; professional, courteous staff; clean/basic room: just what we were looking for. Only complaint is that they were renovating breakfast area during out stay so no coffee/breakfast. I'm guessing that will be fixed in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Your ensuite bathroom is down the hall???”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVietnam
Reviews.Content: I had booked my room at the Visitel by phone from Toronto. The male receptionist assured me that I had a room with an ensuite bathroom. I finally found the hotel after following his wrong directions from the subway station. I dragged my bag up 4 flights of steep stairs to room 401. As he showed me the very, very basic room I asked where is the bathroom? He showed me - down the corridor past two other rooms, but he said it was my "private bathroom." I protested that this is not what I expected or asked for. We played the semantics game around what constitutes a "private bathroom" while I insisted on another room. He said the hotel was full. It was dark and cold and I was in no mood to drag my bag back down four flights of stairs and out into the cold night and go look for another hotel. I endured a night of having to get dressed and remember my card/key when I needed the bathroom. The next morning I met the very nice owner and she gave me a much nicer room with a proper ensuite bathroom for my next night and explained how difficult it was to get good bilingual staff in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last November, It was Good for price, It is basic Hotel ,No fancy But Clean but the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: bgadventures
Reviews.Content: I actually really enjoyed this hotel. Our group of 4 booked 2 rooms for each couple. Both rooms were nice. The only issue I had was that we booked the deluxe room while our friends booked a regular room and it appeared as though they actually gave our friends the deluxe room instead because our bed was smaller.. Anyway, I didnt say anything about that since both rooms were pretty similar and it was only for one night. We had a mini fridge, a desk, tv, wireless internet access worked in the rooms- the rooms were also a great size. Good location too just up the road from the gay village and across from little Italy. The only thing that annoyed me about this place was the staff. We are both young couples and when the lady at the desk explained that the rooms were non-smoking she spoke to us like a teacher scolding her students. That really p***** me off. First of all, we don't smoke anyway. Second of all, we are paying customers- you're not doing us a favour. do not treat us like second class guest because of our age. If we are old enough to use credit cards to book your hotel then we are old enough to understand that the hotel is non-smoking. You don't need to point at the sign continuously and sneer down at us from your reading glasses. Other than that, the hotel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation and recommendation”
Reviews.Author: nazar091
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent week I had with the Visitel ,, Location was very helpful in the centre of the Beautiful City Like Montreal Excellent staff and managements , with a great experience in the industry Clean and resonable prices God bless the staff and the managements

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: asylvia
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Visitel. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful to its guests. The place is clean and very well located near downtown Montreal with easy access to metro and other services. I was pleasantly surprised to find FREE internet access and free local calls as well as a FREE continental breakfast. Hotel management goes above and beyond to satisfy the various needs of its guests so each is made to feel special and at home. I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty coffee pot with green sludge! mid renovations! Terrible breakfast! Really gross grungy patio!”
Reviews.Author: letsgohappyplaces
Reviews.Content: We got to the place and they had double-booked the room we reserved, so they put us in a shabby one with open kitchen pipes sticking out of the walls. They had just ripped out the kitchenette without actually cleaning it up or finishing it, and stuck a bed in the room. The floor was unswept and when I went to use the coffee pot there was a disgusting green mess still left in it. There were large bolts attatched to the bed and hidden under blankets that left a very nasty gash on my foot. The blankets were stained and worn. The towels smelled strange and unpleasant, and the room didn't seem very secure. Half the lights were burnt out. The breakfast was terrible, plain cheap bagels and a couple of banged up apples in a bowl. I would not reccomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: TeamSS
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Montreal my partner booked us into the Visitel. Being on a budget and working in for many years hotels, I knew not to expect much. My suggestion is keep your money and walk across the road to the Hotel European where you get a better room (with its own bathroom) at the same price, plus a complimentary breakfast and even better, free wifi. Visitel not even worth the "cheap" rates. We were booked into a room with a PRIVATE en-suite and they checked us into a room with a share bathroom. We quickly went down to make this known and we were told that as we were paying such a low rate we were definitely not booked into any other room other than what we were given, furthermore if we wanted our own bathroom we needed to pay an additional fee per night. After we presented the printed confirmation (and a lot of debate) we were told we could have the room we thought we'd booked for one night and then we would have to move to another room with a share bathroom. The following morning we went down to discuss our disappointment and that we were not in the wrong, Vanessa was diligent and called through to both the manager and owner to inquire. Following a brief chat with the owner she passed me the phone. On the other end of the phone the owner was talking non stop not allowing me to say a word telling me it was not her problem and that we should speak to the agent we booked it through - we made the reservation online and paid the hotel directly upon check-in. The owner after yelling at me for 2 minutes advised that we had 2 options; leave or move rooms. I have never been spoken to in that manner by anyone, let alone a business operator. This is not tollerable in any industry particularly hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware there is no elevator!”
Reviews.Author: Giggsy1
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, so close to restaurants, Metro station and bus terminal. Very friendly staff and nice rooms with small fridge and kettle. The only issue we had (my 62 year old mum was with me), was hiking up and down the narrow stair case of 4 floors-- especially carrying our luggage as there is no elevator. Good for price, but ask for a room on a low floor!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the $”
Reviews.Author: ncm7772
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the price. As anyone who is familiar w/ Montreal will tell you, it's not a cheap city. Location is great, right near the heart of downtown. Yes, since you're on St-Laurent you may some women of ill refute at night, but that's to be expected in downtown Montreal. Room itself was clean, and bathroom was nice. However, room was SMALL. I chose the 2nd largest room, and it was still tiny. TV was small, and remote didn't work. Also, refridgerator had a weird smell. But it worked. Overall, a decent hotel for the price. If you're in town for fun and don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, I give this place a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: geolpz
Reviews.Content: Very near the bus terminal (100m away). Stayed for 2 nights - pretty good rates, comparable to hostel rates. The bathroom was fine; they provided a TV and boiler. However, they require a credit card as deposit, which I didnt like.

Reviews.Title: “Low price attracts the wrong crowd.”
Reviews.Author: shoogurl
Reviews.Content: Let me start by stating that my husband and I are seasoned travellers. We have stayed at many budget hostels in various countries and had not experienced such a terrible night as we did at Hotel Visitel. I rated the service as 'terrible' however one of the staff members was very nice and helpful. The reason I rated the service low was because we did not receive any compensation for our lousy experience. Apparently the owner was on the night shift and she did not really do anything about the situation-ie-apologize in the morning or leave a note for the morning shift. Here is what happened. Rooms were rented to a group (gang) of 20 something 'boys'. We could not figure out how many their were, but we had encountered them in the lobby earlier in the evening and there were approximately 7 individuals. Around 8 Pm they were already intimidating the front desk gentelman, leaning in and telling him how they did not like one of the other staff members, clearly he had been drinking. Upon returning from dinner around 11 PM. My husband and I decided to stay in and rest up for our next day and night in Montreal. We could hear every person that used the stairs behind our room, from conversations to foot stomping. So we were a bit apprehensive but figured that we were tired enough to sleep through it. The group/gang whatever you want to call it, continued to RUN up and down the stairs for the next 4 hours. The later it got, the louder and more beligerant they became. Talking on cell phones, yelling at eachother, bumping into walls. All the while, numbers of other 'goups' began to assemble outside our window that faced the street. So, now it was approximately 4 AM and my husband and I were in and out of consiousness and exhausted. He got up and looked out the window. There were now three 'groups' of individuals all over the street and infront of OUR hotel. There were also 3 police cars and police officers walking in and out of our hotel. Great. When the police finally got everything under control around 6 AM and it was quiet, someone was clearly locked out of their room and began kicking and pounding on the door next to us. Yelling 'Logan!" over and over. Finally the idiot stomped off. To top off an already insane night, we had a wake up call to our room at 7 AM! Which we did not ask for! So my husband and I slept from 730 am to approx 9 am and were exhausted all day. We obviously checked out but totally lost our morning and our day was ruined because we were so tired from the lunacy of the night before. To make everything worse. When we went to talk to the front desk about what happened and he had no idea about anything. He said the owner, which is a woman, took the night shift and she did not leave any informatio. We made sure to politely explain what had happened and that it was not his fault. But still no discount or anything. So I guess their 24 hr front desk policy means nothing. If I were sitting at the front desk of an establishment that I owned, I would have had the police there a lot earlier. If I did not feel comfortable confronting a gang of 20 year old, wanna be thugs, who probably live in their parents' basement, then I would have called the police earlier or at least a male friend for some support. I also would have stayed or at least came back in the morning to offer some explanation to the other guests who clearly would have been affected. I realize that this probably doesn t happen every day but it is an example of how Hotel Visitel treats their customers and deals with issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel need to be upgraded”
Reviews.Author: Argonne
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 2 nites ,the hotel staff is nice but the place need to be upgraded, We got a rm with 2 double beds on the 2nd floor facing the street, it is small and the floor isn't finished, there's a BIG hole on the floor near the window. Was kind of concern these small creatures may come out at nite time. We noticed that they didn't have new bed sheets and pillow cases when we check in. Do check this out when check in. We switch for another rm but same, have used bed sheets and smelly pillow cases in it. The TV's are the old version type TV and you only get internet connection on the main floor reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgtwill0928
Reviews.Content: My wife had wanted to visit Montreal for several years so we picked a very cold weekend in January. She made reservations at the Hotel Visitel on Rue Saint Hubert. The hotel was small but very nice and very clean. It was extremely close to the Main Metro Station and within two blocks of Rue Saint Denis and an abundance of really nice shops and Restaurants. Our room was nice size and very clean with a small refrigerator in the room. The owner was very friendly and provided a nice continental breakfast. The rate was very affordable for a long weekend stay and they even directed us to areas where you could park for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute room, haunted electronics :)”
Reviews.Author: starshine137
Reviews.Content: This place was great and I would definately stay here again! The bus from the airport stops across the street and the metro is only one block away. It is a great location!! We got a room with a queen bed because I heard the double beds are too small. We also had a private bath. The room was small and cute with character and the people at the front were friendly and helpful. The only issue was the electronics. I think they may have been haunted :) The TV randomly changed channels and would not stay on one channel. Our phone also rang randomly through out the night with no one on the other end. We were out most of the time so the TV was not a huge deal but the 6am call was annoying. The breakfast was VERY basic. Juice, coffee, tea, bread, & bagels but that was fine. I would recommned this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Smile040
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on this site and was very happy I did. The hotel staff where great. Very friendly and offered great information of Montreal. The room was clean and alot bigger then expected. Breakfast was bagels and toast with juice and coffee, which isn't bad, just simple. One thing I was happy I read was to expect that the breakfast area is located pass the laundry room. It's a little different but really not a big deal. Location is amazing, right across from the main bus station. Flew into YUL and took the 747 bus right to the hotel for only 7$ CAD. Overall this place was a great find and we would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but dirty accomodation”
Reviews.Author: kevsachs
Reviews.Content: I looked for a hotel for just one night in Montreal close to the greyhound station. Booking.com advised me to book hotel visitel. The personal wasn't very fluent in English or even understandble French. The room was big with two beds but wasn't so clean. The bath is tiny! It's not very central but perfect for my cause. Taxi to the Center (McGill) is about 12 CAD Who's looking for a "one-night-stand" is ok with VISITEL

Reviews.Title: “I'm not impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paxlulu
Reviews.Content: The only good point with this hotel is that it was clean. As for the bad points: 1. The rate they charged me was higher than the rate I was given on booking.com 2. Staff were unhelpful and apathetic 3. No elevator. Only steep stairs. 4. When reserving the room I knew it would be a shared bathroom. I didn't know the bathroom was another floor all together. 5. The mirror in my room wasn't even mounted on the wall. It was leaning against the wall on the floor. What good is that except for trying on a new pair of shoes? 6. The included breakfast is pathetic. Bagels, bread, jam, peanut butter, juice and coffee. That`s it. This place was not worth money they charge. Next time I'm in Montreal I'll skip this place and go back to Candlewood Suites. Same price but much better amentities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: VTLiberal
Reviews.Content: We were right next to historic and amazing St. Catherine's street, as well as the Village Gai, many great places to eat and shop just outside our hotel. The staff was always available, and we were in a safe part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully Spartan”
Reviews.Author: sushiboy21
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from the bus station. In most places, that's a bad sign but in Montreal it puts you a block from the two main streets. I was pleasantly surprised by the tasteful decor in the room. It was very clean, with a small but modern bathroom. Good water pressure and comfortable bed. TV signal wasn't the greatest. My room had laminate flooring, which I haven't seen in a hotel room before but like as an alternative to grubby carpet. This isn't the Hyatt but as an inexpensive option that puts you in a great location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Strange but good location”
Reviews.Author: KateSheriff
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights in June 2010 and our first impressions were that it was a good location near the Metro station but the staff on reception weren't particularly helpful and, as has been commented by others, we had to pay up front on check-in which was unusual. Our room was on the second floor facing the back with a fire escape right outside the window so we were a little disappointed but at least no traffic noise bothered us. There was no mirror in the room apart from in the bathroom which was a bit inconvenient and the decor had seen better days. The tiny double bed was hardly big enough for 2 small people and every time one of us moved in our sleep the other practically bounced out the other side as the mattress was so springy! A lot of the TV channels had poor reception and the air conditioning was noisy but the room got stuffy even when the weather wasn't hot. There was a note on the window saying we weren't allowed to open it. The bathroom was fine - a fair size with shower over a bath, and it was clean enough but very dated. Breakfast was the worst I've had in a hotel. You have to access the breakfast room through the laundry room and it is a room with no windows painted brown (everything in the room was brown) and it's basically an old fashioned kitchen with sink, oven and cupboards and some toast, bagels, 'orange juice' (cordial), and awful tea and coffee. There weren't enough chairs and tables for all the guests and some people had to stand up or wait for a table to be free. We went out one night and when we came back the receptionist was not on reception and had locked the door. We waited about 5 minutes before he came and let us in. Anther time we went out during the day, our key card had stopped working and when I went downstairs to get it reset, he wasn't there for about 15 minutes, all of that time I spent needing to use the bathroom but having to hang around with other annoyed guests because he'd abandoned reception without leaving a note to say where he was. That was extremely irritating. All in all, this was ok but I expected more even for the cheap rate we got.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic room”
Reviews.Author: Dajego
Reviews.Content: Hotel Visitel is convenient to Montrealâ€™s Latin Quarter and the restaurants of Rue St. Denis. It is not very far to walk to the Old Town, Chinatown, and other downtown places of interest. A Metro stop is nearby. The room we had was rather basic - two beds, 1 chair, and a refrigerator. There were no night tables or lamps - just the overhead light - and no hair dryer in the bathroom. If you care more about location than a room with all the amenities (it is a two-star, not a three- or four-star hotel), this hotel is OK for the price, especially for just one night, and if you have realistic expectations about this basic hotel. The staff was very pleasant and helpful For an extra charge, I was offered one of a few parking spots in the alley back of the hotel, which worked out fine for us, although I had to walk past garbage cans to get to my car. We stayed here for one night shortly after two unfavorable reviews on this website were posted, so I was unsure if we should still stay here. I mentioned the reviews to the staff person, who tried very hard to reassure us. The most notable complaints in those reviews were not present in our case - the air conditioner worked fine, the doorlock worked, the internet connection worked, and we were not bothered by street noise at night. Our room was on the second floor facing the street, so we did not have to hike up to the fourth floor. I did notice at least one room on the ground floor where the window faced the alley and had a window air conditioner, rather than the baseboard-type in our room,; this room may be less appealing. Note: given the choice of recommending this hotel or not to friend, I marked "yes" but I would do so only after reviewing the pros and cons of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Rue Saint Hubert”
Reviews.Author: pmfeldman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at hotels that failed to meet expectations, but this was my first experience of a hotel that flagrantly disregarded explicit, written promises. If any hotel deserves to be classified as a scam operation, this is it. The following is a partial list of problems that we encountered at this establishment: 1. When we arrived at the hotel, I was told that the credit card that had been used for making the reservation would not be honored: "You can use the American Express card for making the reservation, but not for settling the bill". (I'm not sure what would have happened if I had not had another credit card). 2. The confirmed rate was not honored, despite the fact that I had a printout showing this rate. The hotel clerk explained that I would be paying substantially more, and that the cause of the discrepancy was a simple language problem: "The word 'total' does not mean the same thing in Canada and the U.S." 3. We learned that our room was on the 4th floor and that there was no elevator. Getting our suitcases up three steep, narrow flights of stairs was quite a challenge. 4. The deadbolt was not working, making it impossible to lock the door. When I complained about this, I was told that it had been disabled, but not to worry because only hotel staff would be able to enter the room during the night. I ended up blocking the door with a heavy chair. 5. The free WiFi was not usable. Despite the assistance of the hotel clerk, I was unable to load any web pages. 6. Air conditioning and a television were available in one room, but not in the other. 7. In the room that had the air conditioner, the unit was mounted in the window, making it impossible to fully close the window and block out the street noise. My son and I, who were in that room, were unable to sleep most of the night because of noise from vehicles passing in the street. When making the reservation, I had specifically asked for a quiet room. 8. In the early morning, I closed the curtain to block sunlight, but this also blocked the flow of air from the air conditioner. I've never seen a setup like this in any other hotel. 9. The "breakfast" was far and away the worst hotel breakfast that I've ever seen. There was no milk, no yogurt, and in fact, no dairy products of any kind. There was no cereal, no fruit (fresh or otherwise), no muffins, and no pastry. So, what was served? Stale bread and stale bagels! 10. There were a total of three chairs in the breakfast room, so that the four of us could not all sit at the same time. Dr. Phillip M. Feldman

Reviews.Title: “Nice & pleasant hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: manmano
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic - right in the heart of the Latin quater and one stop away from the old Montreal . Interesting hotel with charming and funny rooms. Looks like every room is different from one another , there was a room service everyday . The staff was so friendly and helpful and giving directions and advices . The Internet was free . I really appreciate my stay there .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy it !!”
Reviews.Author: souhail_tn
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and quiet. The location was terrific as I was heart of downtown, just steps away. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were so clean and comfortable .This was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel - Some Staff are Great!”
Reviews.Author: KDC57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was book months in advance and we were promised queen size beds in each room; fridge and microwave in each room; plasma television and air conditioning. Well! The A/C didn't work and after multiple requests to repair it we had to just leave the window open (with no screen) for the entire weekend and sweat the entire time. At least we did have our own washroom within, however the "plasma TV" was just a normal CRT and only about 19 or 20 inches. There was no microwave in the room at all and there wasn't even a chair to sit on while in the room. There were a few members of the staff however who were very cordial. If going to Montreal I would strongly suggest you do NOT stay at Hotel Visitel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and attractive hotel !!!Â Â Â Â ”
Reviews.Author: loryrox
Reviews.Content: Â Â Â Â Â We had a marvelous time at this extremely well-located hotel on the heart of Latin quarter Montreal . From the station it was a very easy walk to the hotel. The staff was super accommodating and extremely tolerant of English-fluently speaking Americans. We were always greeted by an enthusiastic front desk. The Decor style is charming. Rooms were very comfortable .The location is superb. You can walk to the old port ( 10 minutes ) .The hotel area is so active and full of amenities ( restaurants , bars and shops )

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and great personal”
Reviews.Author: trav2003
Reviews.Content: personally had a wonderful time we were in Montreal to attend a conference and it was by chance that we ended up there, down town , renovated rooms and very reasonable prices, the receptionist gave us a good deal for renting more than one room. Loved it
